lexUnit.name: host.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who receives or entertains other people as guests.

sentence.text: As he followed his hosts to the house he noted with distaste the mud which had already splashed his beautiful shining shoes .
` This is where I wrote ` Cop Killer " , " says my genial host .

A genial and stimulating host , his ` Homeric laugh " was the delight of a generation of international lawyers , politicians , officials , and young people who were entertained in his book-lined apartment in Geneva .
He was forthright with his questions but he was also the perfect host .
He was a generous and profligate host , often keeping open-house .
Gentlemen like our good host still believe it 's their business to meddle in matters they do n't understand .
Leith felt dreadful after her host and hostess had gone , and then more than ever was she furious with Naylor .
The sight of both host and hostess apparently sleeping rallied the laggards , eventually , and with apologies they began to stumble to their feet .
The bit where the singing host reaches for the mike and does an ` impromptu " duet with his or her guest always merits a quick lurch for the off button .
The narrow whitewashed streets now play host to jet-setters , artists and students from all over Europe ; and in the evening the whole town comes alive with plenty of discos and lively nightspots .
Fabia drifted off for a second or two as she recalled the pleasantness of the evening , and the charm of her host .
As he began his speech , his hosts at the Mansion House dinner looked on in disbelief :
Dinner had been cheerful and alcoholic , Kevin playing host to his family and slipping back into his old environment as if he had never been away .
` Charles was told that they owed it to their hosts to give of their professional best , " a royal aide said yesterday .
And in a city feeding largely on rice and noodles in a thin soup of stock and vegetables , we learned our hosts were planning a splendid welcoming banquet .
Mr Gorbachev pleased his grinning hosts in East Berlin when he politely remarked that whatever affected the future of the GDR would be decided in Berlin .
Finally one of his hosts explained the source of the racket , a hut in the yard outside .
Flavia stepped forward , looked : looked at her host , looked at the toy landscape--it was a homemade , handmade relief map of the vineyards of France .
